item.title: Score, the dating app for people with good credit, is back
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Two years ago, a controversial dating app was launched and quickly shuttered: for people with good-to-excellent credit. Now, the founder is relaunching it, open to anyone.

item.title: Fusion startup Helion hits blistering temps as it races toward 2028 deadline
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Helion's Polaris device hit 150 million degrees C recently, a milestone that nudges the company toward its commercial power plant that will sell electricity to Microsoft.

item.title: Didero lands $30M to put manufacturing procurement on ‘agentic’ autopilot
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Didero functions as an agentic AI layer that sits on top of a company’s existing ERP, acting as a coordinator that reads incoming communications and automatically executes the necessary updates and tasks.

item.title: Eclipse backs all-EV marketplace Ever in $31M funding round
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The San Francisco-based startup says its AI-first approach has allowed it to scale faster.

item.title: AI inference startup Modal Labs in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: General Catalyst is in talks to lead the round for the four-year-old startup, according to our sources.

item.title: Glean’s fight to own the AI layer inside every company
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit beneath other AI […]

item.title: Who will own your company’s AI layer? Glean’s CEO explains
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit underneath other AI […]

item.title: How to get into a16z’s super-competitive Speedrun startup accelerator program
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: TechCrunch spoke to a16z partner Joshua Lu for some tips on standing out for the Speedrun program.

item.title: The search is on: 2026 Joseph C. Belden Innovation Award nominations are open
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Nominations for the 2026 Joseph C. Belden Innovation Award are open, inviting SMBs with groundbreaking innovation a chance to win scaling opportunities. Last day to apply is February 13.

item.title: UpScrolled’s social network is struggling to moderate hate speech after fast growth
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: UpScrolled, a social network that surged in the wake of the U.S. TikTok deal, has seen an uptick in harmful content, including usernames and hashtags that contain racial slurs.

item.title: Twilio co-founder’s fusion power startup raises $450M from Bessemer and Alphabet’s GV
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Inertia Enterprises will use the Series A investment to build one of the world's most powerful lasers, a key part of its power plant design.

item.title: Former Founders Fund VC Sam Blond launches AI sales startup to upend Salesforce
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The startup, Monaco, has come out of stealth as an AI-native all-in-one CRM plus more system backed by names like the Collison brothers and Garry Tan.

item.title: Upside Robotics is reducing fertilizer use and waste in corn crops
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Upside Robotics builds autonomous solar-powered robots that can help farmers reduce their fertilizer use by 70%.

item.title: Build a pipeline and close deals with an exhibit table at TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Get an unmatched ROI by exhibiting your startup in front of 10,000 tech leaders and investors at TechCrunch Disrupt 2026, October 13-15 in San Francisco. Book your table now before it's gone.

item.title: Integrate raises $17M to move defense project management into the 21st century
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The round was led by FPV Ventures co-founder and managing partner Wesley Chan.

item.title: Complyance raises $20M to help companies manage risk and compliance
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Complyance raised a $20 million Series A led by GV for its AI-native compliance platform.

item.title: Humanoid robot startup Apptronik has now raised $935M at a $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Apptronik has raised another $520 million in a Series A extension to existing and new investors like Google and Mercedes-Benz.

item.title: Meridian raises $17 million to remake the agentic spreadsheet
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: A new company called Meridian.AI has emerged from stealth with an IDE-based approach to agentic financial modeling.

item.title: This Sequoia-backed lab thinks the brain is ‘the floor, not the ceiling’ for AI
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI lab Flapping Airplanes just landed $180 million in seed funding from the likes of Google Ventures, Sequoia, and Index to do something most labs have quietly given up on: making models learn like humans instead of vacuuming up the internet. The founding team, made up of brothers Ben and Asher Spector and co-founder Aidan Smith, is […]

item.title: Former Tesla product manager wants to make luxury goods impossible to fake, starting with a chip
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The startup claims that it has developed a "hack-proof" chip that can't be bypassed by devices like Flipper Zero, a widely available hacking tool that can be used to tamper with wireless systems. These chips are linked with digital certificates to verify the authenticity of the products.
